title: Luigi Panarelli
text:
Luigi Panarelli (born 26 April 1976) is an <a href="Italians">Italian</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> coach and a former player who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
Panarelli started his career at hometown club <a href="Taranto%20Sport">Taranto</a>. He won <a href="Serie%20D">Serie D</a> Champion in 1995. He played another season at Serie C2 before joined Serie A side <a href="S.S.C.%20Napoli">S.S.C. Napoli</a>, which he failed to play regularly. He followed Napoli relegated to Serie B in 1998, but just played 3 times before joined league rival <a href="A.S.%20Fidelis%20Andria">Andria</a>. In summer 1999, he joined Serie A side <a href="Torino%20F.C.">Torino</a> and followed the team relegated in 2000 but just played 5 time in 2 seasons. In summer 2001, he left on loan to Serie B side <a href="F.C.%20Crotone">Crotone</a> as he was the surplus of Torino for the Serie A campaign.
Roma and loans.
In summer 2002, he was signed by <a href="A.S.%20Roma">A.S. Roma</a> in co-ownership deal. That season Torino signed <a href="Alberto%20Maria%20Fontana">Alberto Maria Fontana</a> (tagged for €5.5M), <a href="Giammarco%20Frezza">Giammarco Frezza</a> (tagged for €5M) <a href="Daniele%20Martinetti">Daniele Martinetti</a> (tagged for €1.6M) in co-ownership deal and Roma signed Panarelli in co-ownership deal for €5M, <a href="Gabriele%20Paoletti">Gabriele Paoletti</a> for €5.5M, <a href="Alberto%20Schettino">Alberto Schettino</a> for €1.6M, which made there were no cash involved but generate €12.1M transfer income to both parties and €12.1M cost to amortize in instalments, generate "profit" in the first season.
Panarelli was signed a 3-year contract, which he was rumoured to play for <a href="U.S.%20Citt%C3%A0%20di%20Palermo">Palermo</a>, also owned by Roma President <a href="Franco%20Sensi">Franco Sensi</a>. But after Palermo was sold 1 month later, he was loaned to Serie C2 side <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina%23Della%20Valle%20era">Florentia Viola</a>, the new club to replace the bankrupted A.C. Fiorentina, but failed to play regularly. In the next season, he left for hometown club <a href="Taranto%20Sport">Taranto</a> and played 24 matches at Serie C1. In June 2004, Torino signed remained rights of Frezza, Fontana and Martinetti for free and Roma signed Paoletti for fee and Panarelli Schettino for just €60,000 in total. Panarelli then left for <a href="Teramo%20Calcio">Teramo</a> on loan.
Avellino.
In August 2005, Panarelli signed a contract with <a href="U.S.%20Avellino%201912">Avellino</a>. He was not a regular of the team, and in March 2006 appeared in the reality TV show without asking the permission of the club.
Lega Pro.
He then released by Avellino and in November 2006 signed a contract with <a href="Salernitana%20Calcio%201919">Salernitana</a>. But on 31 January 2007 he joined <a href="U.S.%20Foggia">U.S. Foggia</a>. In August 2007, he signed an annual contract with <a href="S.S.%20Cavese%201919">Cavese</a>. In 2008–09 season, he played regularly for <a href="Lega%20Pro%20Prima%20Divisione">Prima Divisione</a> side <a href="Sorrento%20Calcio">Sorrento</a>. In August 2009, he was signed by <a href="Lega%20Pro%20Seconda%20Divisione">Seconda Divisione</a> side <a href="F.B.%20Brindisi%201912">Brindisi</a> where he played 17 out of first 18 matches. In January 2010, he returned to <a href="Taranto%20Sport">Taranto</a>.
Coaching career.
After retirement, Panarelli became a coach, making his managerial debut in charge of Altamura in 2016. He successively took over at <a href="Serie%20D">Serie D</a> club <a href="Taranto%20F.C.%201927">Taranto</a> in two different stints (from August 2018 to May 2019, and successively from October 2019 to May 2020).
He then served as head coach of <a href="Fidelis%20Andria%202018">Fidelis Andria</a> for the <a href="Serie%20D%202020%E2%80%9321">Serie D 2020–21</a> season, which saw his club ending in third place and then being readmitted to <a href="Serie%20C">Serie C</a> to fill a vacancy. Being confirmed in charge of Fidelis Andria for the new season, he was dismissed on 11 October 2021 due to poor results.
